title: Verify: Selecting MLB.TV Channel successfully opens MLB.TV
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND has gone to the "Channel Store"
AND has added "MLB.TV"
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "MLB.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "MLB.TV" will open successfully

title: Verify: MLB.TV can be accessed while the Roku is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND "MLB.TV" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "MLB.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "MLB.TV" will open successfully

title: Verify: MLB.TV can be accessed while the Roku is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wired network connection
AND "MLB.TV" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "MLB.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "MLB.TV" will open successfully

title: Home: Verify if there are games available for Today that the 'Today's Games' option displays
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed MLB.TV
AND there are games scheduled for Today
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the Channel
AND we are brought to the main menu page
custom_expected: THEN the 'Today's Games' option will display on the Main Menu

title: Home: Verify if there are no games available for Today that the 'Today's Games' option does not display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed MLB.TV
AND there are no games scheduled for Today
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the Channel
AND we are brought to the main menu page
custom_expected: THEN the 'Today's Games' option will NOT display on the Main Menu

title: Home: Verify the default highlighted selection when the app is accessed is 'Today's games' (Games available)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND there are games scheduled for today
custom_steps: WHEN the user is brought to the Main Menu
custom_expected: THEN the Today's Games option will be highlighted by default

title: Home: Verify the default highlighted select when the app is accessed is 'Browse by team' (No games available)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND there are NO games scheduled for today
custom_steps: WHEN the user is brought to the Main Menu
custom_expected: THEN the Browse by Team option will be highlighted by default

title: Home: Image updates based on highlighted menu option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user uses the navigation arrows
AND toggles between the different Menu Options
custom_expected:
THEN the image on the right will update accordingly
AND the image on the right will correspond to the highlighted menu item

title: Home: 'Today's Games' option updates to display at 10 AM
custom_preconds:
Given the user accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND that the season isn't over
AND there were no games on the previous day
AND there are games scheduled for today
AND the time is before 10 AM EST
custom_steps: WHEN the time hits 10 AM EST
custom_expected: THEN Today's Games option will appear accordingly

title: Home: Verify options display accordingly
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the Main Menu
custom_expected:
THEN the following Menu Items will display:
> Today's Games (conditional on games)
> Browse by team
> Browse recent games
> Settings

title: Home:  	Verify text and formatting is clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Menu
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be clear
AND all text will be formatted correctly

title: Today: User selects 'Today's Games' opens page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Today's Games from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN the Today's Games page will open accordingly

title: Today: Cursor highlight should start in Top of the Game List
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
custom_steps: WHEN the page opens
custom_expected: THEN the cursor highlight should default to the top most game cell

title: Today: Verify all games can be navigated to and selected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has selected the Today's Games section
AND there are more than one games available for the day
custom_steps:
WHEN the page loads
AND the user traverses through the games
custom_expected:
THEN all games can be highlighted
AND all games are selectable

title: Today: Verify that Game Data updates/refreshes every 30 seconds
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
AND there are games currently live/active
custom_steps:
WHEN a team scores
OR a game state changes
custom_expected: THEN the data will be properly reflected within 30 seconds of the data becoming available

title: Today: Verify Show Scores is set by default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user has never navigated to the settings page
AND there are games that are In Progress
OR there are games that have moved to Final
AND the user selected the Today's Games page
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the day's games
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the scores for the games in the data overlays

title: Today: Verify the Away team is always displayed on the Left with the Home Team displayed on the Right
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user has navigated to the Today's Games section
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses through the day's games
AND looks at the team matchup logos
custom_expected:
THEN the Away team will always display on the Left
AND the Home team will always display on the Right

title: Today: Verify Team Logos on the right correspond with selected Team Matchup on the left
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates through the different games for the day
custom_expected: THEN the team logos on the right will correspond with the highlighted teams lists on the left

title: Today: Verify there is no visual overlapping when changing device settngs
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses through the games for the day
AND changes the device visual settings
custom_expected:
THEN there will be no data overlap
AND all images will display accordingly
AND all text will display accordingly

title: Today: Verify that the day flips at 10 AM
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND it is before 10 AM
AND the user has already viewed the Today's Games section to see yesterday's games
custom_steps:
WHEN it becomes 10 AM
AND the user accesses the Today's Games section again
custom_expected: THEN the games will properly update to reflect the actual games from today

title: Today:  	Verify text and formatting is clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the has navigated to the Today's Games section
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses the page
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be clear
AND all formatting will be without issue

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if we have linked to an MLB.TV Annually subscribed account that we can watch Video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Annual Account (mlbtesttv+2@gmail.com / tester)
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free MLB.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if we have linked to an MLB.TV Monthly subscribed account that we can watch Video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Monthly Account (mlbtesttv+5@gmail.com / tester)
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free MLB.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if we have linked to an MLB.com Gameday Audio account that we are unable to view Video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Gameday Audio Account (mlbtesttv+3@gmail.com / tester)
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play an MLB.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be unable to play the stream

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if we have linked to an MLB.TV Executive account that we can watch Video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Executive Account (media6@mlbtest.com / password)
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free MLB.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if a user has previously linked to an MLB.com Account through Settings that they are able to start up an MLB.TV stream if they have the correct subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to Settings
AND has linked to an account with a valid MLB.TV subscription
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to start up an MLB.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the MLB.TV stream successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that we can play an MLB.TV Stream while utilizing a WiFi Connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Roku device is connected using a wireless network connection
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Annual Account
OR we have linked to an MLB.com Monthly Account
AND there is an active game available
AND that active game has a valid MLB.TV Stream
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to start up the MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that we can play an MLB.TV Stream while utilizing a Wired Connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Roku device is connected using a wired network connection
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Annual Account
OR we have linked to an MLB.com Monthly Account
AND there is an active game available
AND that active game has a valid MLB.TV Stream
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to start up the MLB.TV Stream
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV Stream begins to play successfully

title: ***MLB.TV: Verify that if we select a game where our Favorite Team is playing and we bring up the MLB.TV Streams that the Favorite Team's feed will be the one that is defaulted
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have a Favorite Team currently set
AND we have selected an active game that our Favorite Team is currently playing
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Game Page
AND we press the Play button
custom_expected:
THEN the cursor will jump to the Watch option our Favorite Teams feed
AND the user will be prompted for the playback options

title: MLB.TV: Pressing down navigation arrow brings up game overlay information (Matchup/Date/Duration)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user has launched and MLB.TV stream for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Down navigation arrow on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear
AND the Matchup details for the game will display
AND the Game's Date will display
AND the Duration will display (for archives)

title: MLB.TV: Pressing up navigation arrow backs out of playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has launched an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Up navigation arrow on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be exited out of the video playback
AND the user will be brought Back to the Game's page

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will not play for a user not linked to any account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any MLB Account
AND there is a Free Game of the Day available
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to play a game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an access denied message
AND the user will be instructed that they must link their account to access the media

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will play for a user linked with a free MLBAM account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.com with No Entitlements
AND there is a Free Game of the Day Available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be prompted with the pay wall
AND the feed will startup accordingly

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will play for a user linked to an MLB.com Gameday Audio Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Gameday Audio Account (mlbtesttv+3@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Free Game of the Day Available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be prompted with the pay wall
AND the feed will startup accordingly

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will successfully play for a user linked to an MLB.TV Monthly Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Monthly Account (mlbtesttv+5@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Free Game of the Day Available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected: THEN the Video will begin to play successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will successfully play for a user linked to an MLB.TV Annual Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Annual Account (mlbtesttv+2@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Free Game of the Day Available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected: THEN the Video will begin to play successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that the Free Game of the Day will successfully play for a user linked to an MLB.com Executive Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Executive Account (media6@mlbtest.com / password)
AND there is a Free Game of the Day Available
custom_steps: When we attempt to play the game labeled as the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected: THEN the Video will begin to play successfully

title: ***MLB.TV: Verify that Game of the Day title matches server config
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed At Bat
AND the user has launched At Bat
AND the user has logged in with a valid MLB.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the MLB.TV option at the bottom of the screen
AND the list of games displays
custom_expected: THEN the "MLB.TV Game of the Day" title will match/be replaced with the appropriate "freeGameLabels" setting in the configuration

title: ***MLB.TV: Free Game labeling does not appear for linked users
MLB.TV: Verify that Local Blackouts are enforced on non-executive MLB.com Accounts (Annual / Monthly)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Annual Account
OR we have linked to an MLB.com Monthly Account
AND we are within the blackout region of a locally blacked out game
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to startup the MLB.TV stream
custom_expected:
THEN the stream will not start successfully
AND the user will be prompted with a message regarding that particular game being blacked out

title: MLB.TV: Verify that National Blackout games are properly enforced where users inside of the United States & Canada will not be able to startup the MLB.TV Stream successfully
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Annual Account
OR we have linked to an MLB.com Monthly Account
AND there is a National Blackout game available
AND we are within the blackout region of the blacked out game
AND the National Blackout game is currently active
AND there is at least one MLB.TV Stream currently enabled for that particular game
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to startup the MLB.TV Stream for that National Blackout game
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB.TV stream doesn't start up successfully
AND the user receives a message about the game being blacked out

title: MLB.TV: Verify that National Blackout games in the United States & Canada can properly be viewed by International Users
custom_preconds:
Given that there is a National Blackout game available
And we have a QA Location Override Build
And we have set the QA Location Override coordinates to that of a place not in the United States
And we have set the QA Location Override coordinates to that of a place not in Canada
And the National BLackout game is currently active
And there is at least one MLB.TV STream currently enabled for that particular game
custom_steps: When we attempt to startup the MLB.TV Stream for the National Blackout game
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV stream starts up successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify that Blackout Restrictions work properly for Canadian Users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have a game being played in Canada (Toronto)
AND we have a QA Location Override Build
AND we have set the QA Location Override coordinates to that of a place inside Canada
AND the user is currently linked to a valid MLB.com Annual Account
OR the user is currently linked to a valid MLB.com Monthly Account
AND the game being played is currently active
AND there is at least one MLB.TV Stream currently enabled for that particular game
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to startup the MLB.TV Stream for that particular game
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB.TV stream doesn't start up successfully
AND the user receives a message about the game being blacked out

title: MLB.TV: Verify that Blackout Restrictions still apply to the Free Game of the Day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have a Free Game of the Day currently available
AND the Free Game of the Day is currently active
AND we are within the local broadcast region of a team of the Free Game of the Day
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Annual Account
OR we have linked to an MLB.com Monthly Account
AND there is at least one MLB.TV Stream currently enabled for the Free Game of the Day
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to startup the MLB.TV Stream on the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB.TV stream doesn't start up successfully
AND the user receives a message about the game being blacked out

title: Verify: When choosing the 'Watch' option for an Archive, the user sees a 'Jump to inning' option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user is linked to a valid MLB.TV account
AND there is an archive available
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to watch the archive feed
custom_expected: THEN the user will see an option to 'Jump to Inning'

title: Inning: Selecting 'Jump to inning' opens appropriate navigation page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is linked to a valid MLB.TV account
AND the user has accessed an MLB.TV Archive
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects 'Jump to Inning'
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to an Inning navigation page

title: Inning: 'Jump to inning' displays proper inning information for selected game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND there are multiple Archives available
AND there are Archives for games that ended in more than 9 innings
OR there are Archives for games that ended in less than 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to watch the Archive Feeds
AND selects the Jump to Inning options
custom_expected: THEN the Inning navigation pages match the inning counts for the selected game(s)

title: Inning: Selecting an inning accurately jumps the user to the appropriate video position
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user has linked to a valid MLB.TV account
AND there are Archive games available
custom_steps: WHEN the user uses the Jump to Inning option when launching an archive stream
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the selected Inning frame
AND the video will begin playing at that point successfully

title: Inning: Matchup logos appear accurately
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed an Archive game
AND has selected the Jump to Inning navigation
custom_steps: WHEN the Select Inning screen displays
custom_expected: THEN the team logos that appear on the right correspond to the selected game

title: Feed: Verify selecting 'TV feed' overlays TV Broadcast Audio with video
custom_preconds:
GIVE the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has accessed a game with multiple sources available
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the 'TV feed' Audio Source
custom_expected: THEN the default TV feed audio will overlay the broadcast

title: Feed: Verify selecting 'Local radio' overlays Radio Broadcast with video
custom_preconds:
GIVE the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has accessed a game with multiple sources available
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the 'Local radio' Audio Source
AND watches the video feed
custom_expected:
THEN the video will play
AND the Radio broadcast will overlay the MLB.TV stream instead of the default TV broadcast

title: Feed: Verify selecting 'Ballpark sound' overlays the non-announcer audio with the video playback
custom_preconds:
GIVE the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has accessed a game with multiple sources available
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects 'Ballpark sound'
AND watches the video feed
custom_expected:
THEN the video will play
AND the 'Ballpark sound' audio will overlay the MLB.TV stream (no announcers)

title: Feed: Verify changing Audio Feed settings for one game does not apply to all games
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid MLB.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user changes the Audio Feed Settings for a game
AND moves to a different game
AND opens the Audio Source settings for that game
custom_expected:
THEN the settings will not reflect the modified settings from the previous game
AND will remain as the default Audio Source

title: Feed: Verify Audio Feed changes for a game are retained while the user is in the application
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has modified the Audio Source for a game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to different areas of the Channel
AND accesses different video feeds
AND returns to the initial game
custom_expected: THEN the modified Audio Source for the game will remain as the modified settings

title: Feed: Verify Audio Feed changes reset to default when the user exits and returns to the application
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has modified the Audio Source for an MLB.TV game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user exits the Channel
AND accesses the Channel again
AND returns to the game with the modified audio settings
custom_expected: THEN the Audio Source will have reverted to the default TV feed setting

title: Start: User selects Resume
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the user has already begun viewing an MLB.TV stream
AND the user has exited the stream before completion
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the previously watched game
AND attempts to watch it again
AND presses he Resume option
custom_expected: THEN the video stream will continue where the user left off

title: Start: User selects Start from beginning
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has previously begun watching an MLB.TV stream
AND exited the playback before completion
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game
AND chooses the option to Watch
AND selects 'Start from beginning'
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will launch
AND the stream will restart at the beginning

title: Start: User selects Jump to inning (archive)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid MLB.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects to watch an MLB.TV archive
AND selects the 'Jump to inning' option
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to an inning navigation control
AND selecting this will bring the user to the corresponding video location

title: Start: User selects Cancel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects to Watch an MLB.TV stream
AND is at the 'Choose start option' screen
AND selects Cancel
custom_expected:
THEN the 'Chose start option' menu will close
AND the user will be brought back to the game page

title: Start: Verify Resume is not an available option for a stream that has not been started before by the user
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid MLB.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user chooses to Watch an MLB.TV feed
AND has not previously attempted to watch this feed
custom_expected: THEN the user will NOT see the 'Resume' option in the Choose start option menu

title: Verify: User returns to a previous streamed game, the Resume option is present
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has linked to a valid MLB.TV account
AND has previously accessed an MLB.TV stream for a game
AND did not complete the playback
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game
AND attempts to Watch the feed
custom_expected: THEN the Choose start Option menu will include the option to Resume

title: Verify: User's previous location is stored even if the user exits the application and returns
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has linked to a valid MLB.TV account
AND has previously accessed an MLB.TV stream for a game
AND did not complete the playback
AND has since exited the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN the user accesses the Channel again
AND returns to the game
AND chooses the Watch option
AND selects to Resume the playback
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought back to the video playback location where they last left off

title: ***MLB.TV: Verify that if we send the Channel to the background while an MLB.TV Stream is actively playing that when the application is reaccessed that bookmark will be retained
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have an MLB.TV Stream actively playing
AND we press the Home button on the remote to exit the Channel
custom_steps:
WEN we re-access the Channel
AND we navigate back to the game that was playing
custom_expected:
WHEN we Resume the stream
THEN the stream will resume from where it left off

title: Recap: Verify selecting Game Recap if we have not linked with an account brings up a Link Account message
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any MLB Account
AND there is a Game Recap available for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to view the Game Recap
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an access denied message
AND the user will be instructed that they must link their account to access the media

title: Recap: Verify if we have linked to a Free Account that the Game Recap option is not visible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.com with No Entitlements
AND there is a Game Recap for a game available
custom_steps: WHEN we view the game with the Game Recap
custom_expected: Then we will not see the Game Recap as an available option

title: Recap: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Annually subscribed account that we can watch Game Recaps
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Annual Account (mlbtesttv+2@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Game Recap for a game available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the Game Recap
custom_expected: THEN the recap will play successfully

title: Recap: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Monthly subscribed account that we can watch Game Recaps
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Monthly Account (mlbtesttv+5@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Game Recap available
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play the Game Recap
custom_expected: THEN the recap will play successfully

title: Recap: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Gameday Audio account that we are unable to view the recap option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.com Gameday Audio Account (mlbtesttv+3@gmail.com / tester)
AND there is a Game Recap available for a game
custom_steps: WHEN we access the game page
custom_expected: Then we will not see the Game Recap option

title: Recap: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Executive account that we can watch Game Recaps
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an MLB.TV Account
AND we have linked to an MLB.TV Executive Account (media6@mlbtest.com / password)
AND there is a Game Recap available
custom_steps: When we attempt to start up the Game Recap
custom_expected: Then the recap will play successfully

title: Recap: Verify that after the Game Recap ends, that the user is returned to the Game Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to a valid MLB.TV Account
AND there is a Game Recap for a game available
custom_steps:
WHEN the user plays the Game Recap
AND the Recap playback reaches the end
custom_expected: THEN we will be returned to the Game Page

title: Overlay: Verify when user highlights a game matchup cell, the overlay that appears properly reflects the highlighted game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the user highlights a matchup
custom_expected:
THEN an information overlay will appear
AND the Team Names will display
AND the Away Team will be listed, followed by the Home Team
AND the Game Date will display
AND the Game State will display
AND the score will display (if setting allows)

title: Overlay: Verify overlay respects Show Scores setting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the user modifies the Show Scores setting
custom_expected: THEN the Scores will Show/Hide on the information overlay accordingly

title: Overlay: Verify team names are spelled correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND all teams have games listed
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the games
custom_expected: THEN all Team Names will be spelled correctly

title: Overlay: Home teams are always listed after Away teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the games
custom_expected:
THEN the Away team will be listed first
AND the Home team will be listed after

title: Overlay: Verify the overlay properly updates as the user navigates across different game cells
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses the navigation across different game matchups
custom_expected: THEN the overlay properly updates to reflect the newly highlighted game matchup information

title: Overlay: Text and game state formatting on games should be clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses the section
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be displayed clearly
AND all text will be formatted without issue

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that the "Game Over" state displays as Final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game that has completed
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game overlay will NOT reflect the inning state anywhere
AND the team names will be correct
AND the game date will be correct
AND the game overlay will reflect instead the words Final
AND the Final score will display correctly
> Depending on Show Scores setting

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that a game finishing in less then 9 innings will appear as Final/<inningsPlayed>
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game available in a state of Final
AND this particular game was finished in less then 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected: THEN the game's status will show as Final/<inningsPlayed>

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that if a game finishes in the normal 9 innings that it reflects as Final on the Info Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND we have a game that has finished in 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected: THEN the game overlay will reflect the state of Final for that particular game

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that a game finishing in Extra Innings will appear as F/<inningsPlayed>
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game available in a state of Final
AND this particular game was finished in greater then 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected: THEN the game's status will show as Final/<inningsPlayed>

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify an in game "Ceremony" reflects correctly on the Info Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game in the state of Ceremony available
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the inning is still shown
AND we will see that the word "Ceremony" appears under the inning in question

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that when a game goes into a state of Replay that it is correctly reflected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game in the state of Replay available
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will reflect the correct inning state followed by inning
AND below this there will be the words Replay

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that a game in a state of Delay reflects properly on the Info Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game in the state of Delay available
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the correct <inningState><inningNumber> being displayed
AND below that we will see the word "Delay"

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that a Postponed Game reflects correctly on the Information Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND we have a game in the state of Postpone available
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at the game in question
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game overlay will NOT reflect the inning state anywhere
AND the team names will be correct
AND the game date will be correct
AND the game overlay will reflect instead the words 'Postponed'

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that when we click on a Postponed Game that it opens the Game Details stating as such
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND we have a game in the state of Postpone available
custom_steps: WHEN we open on the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN the Game Details will appear
AND the Game Page will state:
> Game is postponed. Please visit mlb.com for more information.

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that a resumption of a suspended game with no probable pitchers reflects properly on the Game Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND the game is a resumption of a suspended game
AND there are no probable pitchers set for the game
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the game in question
custom_expected:
THEN the game's overlay will show the game time
AND shows 'Suspended' beneath the game time
AND the score will be shown on the overlay
AND there will not be innings shown on the overlay
AND will display 'Game is resumed from <M><D><YYYY>

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that a game in a state of Forfeit reflects properly on the Info Overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game in the state of Forfeit available
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at the game in question
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game will NOT show the innings on the Info Overlay
AND the game will show the words Forfeit instead

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify that when a game has been Completed Early that it's displayed as 'Final/<inningsPlayed>'
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game available that has been 'Completed Early'
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at the game in question
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game will not display the status of 'Completed Early' 
AND will display as 'Final/<inningsPlayed>' instead

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that if we have a Back-to-Back Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to a date that contains a "Back-To-Back" double header
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the games are listed correctly
AND the second game's time should be labeled as "TBD"

title: Overlay (Game States): Verify if we have a Regular Double Header that the Detail Information shows up correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a date that contains a regular "Double Header"
AND we open up the Detail View of each game
custom_expected: THEN we will see that the games are listed correctly

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that if Hide Scores if turned ON that games that finish in less then 9 innings will appear as Final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has gone to Settings
AND has ENABLED Hide Scores
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game available in a state of Final
AND this particular game was finished in less then 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game's status will be listed as Final
AND the <inningsplayed> will NOT be displayed

title: ***Overlay (Game States): Verify that if Hide Scores if turned ON that games that finish in more then 9 innings will appear as Final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has gone to Settings
AND has ENABLED Hide Scores
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
AND there is a game available in a state of Final
AND this particular game was finished in more then 9 innings
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at that particular game
AND the overlay is visible
custom_expected:
THEN the game's status will show as Final
AND the <inningsPlayed> will not be displayed

title: Game: Pressing Play button on Game Page launches Start Options for Default Video Stream
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an authorized MLB.TV Account
AND we have navigated to a Game Page with active media (Live/Archive)
custom_steps: WHEN we press the Play button on the Roku Remote
custom_expected: THEN we are presented with the Start Options for the main video stream

title: ***Game: Verify options when there is no media available
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an authorized MLB.TV Account
AND we have navigated to a Game Page with NO active media (Live/Archive)
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the navigation options on this page
custom_expected:
THEN there will be no Watch options
AND there will be no Audio Feed Settings
AND there will be no Game Recap (if available)
AND there will be a 'Go Back' option

title: Game: Verify options when there is media available and the user is linked to a valid account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an authorized MLB.TV Account
AND we have navigated to a Game Page with active media (Live/Archive)
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the options on this page
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the 'Watch' options for the labeled available feeds
AND we will see the 'Play game recap' option (if available)
AND we will see the 'TV audio feed settings' option

title: Game: Verify options when there is media available and the user is not linked to an account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have NOT linked to an authorized MLB.TV Account
AND we have navigated to a Game Page with active media (Live/Archive)
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the navigation options on this page
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the 'Watch' options for the labeled available feeds
AND we will see the 'Play game recap' option (if available)
AND we will NOT see the 'TV audio feed settings' option
AND selecting either of these options will result in a Paywall 'Link Account' message

title: Game: Verify Team logos, game time, stadium, etc all appear correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND there is a game that has not started
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Game Details page for the unstarted game
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to the Game Detail view 
AND the user can see the team logos, game time, stadium & other relevant info appear correctly

title: Game: Verify Home team is listed after Away team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND there is a game that is currently Active
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Game Details page for the game
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the home team underneath/after the away team in the Game Detail view

title: Game Detail: Verify when game is in 'Warmup' game details view is tappable and have no game data recorded
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the scoreboard page
And the particular game is in 'Warmup'
custom_steps: When the user taps the game cell of the applicable game
custom_expected:
Then they are taken to the Game Details view 
And the game details view does not have any game data recorded yet

title: Game Detail: Verify pitching counts are appearing correctly on game details page and on scoreboard
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the game is in progress and updating
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the pitch counts appearing correctly on the scoreboard 
And the user should see the pitch counts appearing correctly in the Game Detail view

title: Game Detail: Verify the app handles basepad occupation correctly on gameday
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Game Detail view
custom_steps: When players are occupying the bases
custom_expected:
Then this should be accurately reflected on the Game Detail view by showing base runners on the correct base
And updating properly

title: Game Detail: Verify innings are updating correctly in the Game Detail view
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Game Detail view
custom_steps: When the game is ongoing
custom_expected: Then the innings should be updating correctly

title: Game Detail: Scoreboard: Put the game in a delayed start - verify correct behavior
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When a game is put into a delayed start state
custom_expected:
Then the scoreboard will show the delay 
But the Gameday Preview icon will still appear on the scoreboard 
And the user will not be able to access the Game Detail view

title: Game Detail: Verify that if a game is put into the Delayed state of Ceremony that it says Ceremony
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When a game is put into a delayed start state
custom_expected:
Then the scoreboard will show the delay as Ceremony
And when we open up Game Detail view we will see that it also states Ceremony inside of it

title: Game Detail: Verify Team logos, game time, stadium, etc all appear correctly
custom_preconds: Given the game has not started
custom_steps: When the user taps the cell of a game from the scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then the user is taken to the Game Detail view 
And the user can see the team logos, game time, stadium & other relevant info appear correctly

title: Game Detail: Verify lineups appear correctly, correct starting pitcher and batter
custom_preconds: Given the game is in warmup state
custom_steps: When the user taps the cell for the game on the scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then the correct batter is shown on the Game Detail view
And the correct pitcher is shown on the Game Detail view

title: Game Detail: Verify stolen bases update correctly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Game Detail view
custom_steps: When a stolen base occurs or is entered
custom_expected:
Then the Stolen Base should update correctly 
And the Stolen Base will be reflected in the pitch by pitch section 
And the Stolen Base will also be reflected on the basepad indicator

title: Game Detail: Verify player names appear correctly and are readable
custom_preconds: Given the user is on Game Detail view
custom_expected:
Then the player's name will appear correctly 
And the player's name will be readable

title: Game Detail: Verify that the Matchup area updates appropriately when pushing on a new game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND there are at least 2 games in the state of 'Live' available
AND we launch the Game Detail view for the 1st Game
AND we navigate back to the scoreboard
AND we startup the Game Detail view for the 2nd Game
custom_expected: THEN the Game Detail view will display appropriately for each game's data

title: Game Detail: Home team is listed after away team
custom_preconds: Given there is an active game
custom_steps:
When the user opens up the app
And goes to the scoreboard
And taps on the game cell of an active game
custom_expected: Then the user will see the home team underneath/after the away team in the Game Detail view

title: Game Detail: Verify that tapping the current Pitcher and Batter doesn't cause a crash
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to Game Detail view
AND we tap on the Pitcher
AND we tap on the Batter at the same time
custom_expected: THEN the Application will not crash

title: Scoreboard: Verify that if Pitchers on the "Wrap" screen have double digit wins / losses that they stay within the borders correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND we navigate to a game that has moved to  a state of "Final"
AND this particular game in question has a pitcher with double digit wins
OR this particular game in question has a pitcher with double digit losses
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the pitching information stays inside the borders correctly on the scoreboard
And we will see that the pitching information stays inside the borders correctly on the Game Detail view

title: Scoreboard: Delayed State: Verify Game Detail view is clickable and no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have opened up Game Detail view for a game
And this game is currently in the status of Delayed
custom_expected: Then we no longer see any data updating with post Delay data

title: Scoreboard: Delayed State: Verify Game appears as 'Delayed' or 'Del' on scoreboard and in Game Detail view
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When the game goes into or is put into a Delayed state
custom_expected:
Then that state is indicated on the scoreboard 
And that state is indicated on the Game Detail view

title: Scoreboard: Delayed State: Verify all possible delayed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of delay, Rain, Snow, Ceremony, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the delayed state without issue

title: Scoreboard: Postponed State: Verify all possible postponed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of postponement, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the Postponed state without issue

title: Scoreboard: Postponed State: Verify Game Detail view is no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected a game
And this game is currently in a state of Postponement
custom_steps: When the user views the Game Detail view
custom_expected:
Then they are able to click around successfully
And the data inside that particular game will not update any longer

title: Scoreboard: Suspended State: Verify Game appears as 'Suspended' or 'Susp' on scoreboard and in Game Detail view
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:
Then the game should appear as suspended on the scoreboard
And the game will appear as suspended in all the Gameday Detail view

title: Scoreboard: Suspended State: Verify all possible delayed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of suspension, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the suspended state without issue

title: Scoreboard: Suspended State: Verify suspended game is sorted properly in the scoreboard according to the sorting rules
custom_preconds: Given that the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:
Then the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are in progress
And the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are still scheduled to be played

title: Scoreboard: Suspended State: Verify Game Detail view is no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected a game
And we have opened that game to it's Game Detail view
And that game is currently in the state of Suspend
custom_expected:
Then we are able to navigate successfully
And we no longer see any data updating for that particular game

title: Game: Final State: Verify Game appears as 'Final' on the Info Overlay and in the Game Detail view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN there is a game that has gone Final
custom_expected: THEN the game should appear as Final on the Info Overlay and in the Game Detail view

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends early appears correctly on Game Detail view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a game that ends before 9 innings in mid inning
OR there is a game that ends before 9 innings after the completion of an inning
custom_expected:
THEN the game should appear and act as Final game on the Info Overlay
AND the game should appear and act as Final game in the Game Detail view once selected

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends normally appears correctly on Game Detail view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN a game has completed
custom_expected:
THEN game will appear as a Final Game on the Info Overlay
AND the game will appear as a Final Game in the Game Detail view

title: Game: Final State: Verify a game that ends with extended periods appears correctly on Game Detail view (in both mid inning and complete innings)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps:
WHEN a game has completed in extra innings
AND the user selects the game
custom_expected:
THEN it should appear as a Final game in the Game Details
AND it should be indicated that the game went more than 9 innings, (eg. Final/12)

title: Game: Final State: Verify that when a game has been completed early that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings (Team Page, Recent Games, etc)
custom_steps:
WHEN a game has been 'Completed Early'
AND we navigate to  Game Detail view for that specific game
custom_expected: THEN we will see the game status as 'Final/n' instead of mentioning 'Completed Early'

title: Team: User selects 'Browse by team' opens page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects 'Browse by team' from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN the 'Browse by team' page will open accordingly

title: Team: When on the 'Browse by Team' filter is open teams are sorted by League Divisions accordingly
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps: WHEN the 'Browse by team' page opens
custom_expected:
THEN teams are sorted by League Divisions
> American League East
> American League Central
> American League West
> National League East
> National League Central
> National League West

title: Team: When on the 'Browse by Team' filter is open teams are sorted by League Divisions with Favorite Teams appearing in the Top Section
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we have at least one Favorite Team Set
custom_steps: WHEN the 'Browse by team' page opens
custom_expected:
THEN the Favorite Teams row is sorted to the top section
AND teams are sorted by League Divisions below this
> American League East
> American League Central
> American League West
> National League East
> National League Central
> National League West

title: Team: Verify when no favorite team is selected that the Favorite Teams row does not appear
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we have NO Favorite Teams Set
custom_steps: WHEN the 'Browse by team' page opens
custom_expected:
THEN the Favorite Team row will NOT be present
AND the League Division rows appear accordingly

title: Team: Verify reaching the end of the row content loops back to the beginning
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a Division row
AND we scroll left
OR we scroll right
custom_expected:
THEN the rows' contents will continuously loop
AND the user will be able to navigate both directions without issue

title: Team: Verify user is able to scroll down to view additional team lists
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate down
custom_expected:
THEN the unseen division rows will display
AND we can navigate back up to see the initial rows

title: Team: Verify all favorite teams appear in Favorite Teams row
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected multiple Favorite Teams
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the Favorite Teams row
custom_expected:
THEN all Favorite Teams will appear
AND all Team logos will be accurate

title: Team: Infinite row navigation only applies to rows with 5 or more items
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected up to 4 Favorite Teams
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Favorite Teams row
AND we scroll left
OR we scroll right
custom_expected:
THEN the navigation will not be continuous
AND the user can only scroll until they reach the end of the list

REPEAT for both directions

title: Team: Verify once thumbnail loads and the user scrolls away, it will not reload each time the row is visible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses the rows' content
AND the logos for the Division Teams load
AND the user navigates away so the Division row is no longer visible
AND navigates back to the Division row
custom_expected:
THEN the team logo will already be present
AND the images will not reload

title: TeamPage: Selecting a team properly opens the proper team page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps: WHEN we select a Team
custom_expected:
THEN the corresponding Team Page will open
AND all data will match the selected team

REPEAT for each team

title: TeamPage: Verify appropriate team name appears in top right corner
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps: WHEN we select a Team
custom_expected:
THEN the corresponding Team Page will open
AND the selected team's name will appear in the top right corner

REPEAT for each team

title: TeamPage: Scrolling down the list, the MLB.TV placeholder image appears before matchup logos load
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we have selected a random team
custom_steps:
WHEN we scroll down the dated rows
AND we have not given the icons time to load
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB.TV placeholder image will appear before the row contents
AND this placeholder will only appear once per row (not for each game)

title: TeamPage: Games properly sort / group in descending order
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we have selected a random team
custom_steps:
WHEN the team page loads
AND the different games display for the weeks
custom_expected:
THEN the weeks (Sunday - Saturday) will be grouped in descending order 
AND the games will be listed in ascending chronological order in the row (left to right)

title: TeamPage: User is able to scroll down the game list without issue
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a random team's page
AND we traverse the different rows
AND we navigate down the list
custom_expected:
THEN the navigation will be without issue
AND we can scroll back up successfully

title: TeamPage: Verify reaching the end of the row content loops back to the beginning
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we select a Random team
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to row with at least 5 games listed
AND we navigate to the right
AND we navigate to the left
custom_expected: THEN the games will continuously loop for the week

title: TeamPage: Verify that we can traverse around the Team section without issue and that the thumbnails and formatting look correct
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we have selected a random Team
custom_steps: WHEN we traverse the team section
custom_expected:
THEN all the thumbnails will be formatted correctly
AND there will be no visible formatting issues

title: TeamPage: Verify once thumbnail loads and the user scrolls away, it will not reload each time the row is visible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse by team'
AND we select a random team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses the rows' content
AND the matchup/logos for the dates load
AND the user navigates away so the date row is no longer visible
AND navigates back to the date row
custom_expected:
THEN the matchup/logos will already be present
AND the images will not reload

title: Recent: Verify Away team always displays before the Home team in the matchup listings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND we have selected 'Browse Recent Games'
custom_steps: WHEN we traverse the different rows
custom_expected: THEN the Home team will always display after the Away team in the matchups

title: Settings: User selects 'Settings' opens page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects 'Settings' from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN the 'Settings' page will open accordingly

title: Settings: Linked user's avatar displays
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked their BAMNET Account
AND has set a BAMNET avatar
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected: THEN the linked account's BAMNET avatar will display on the right hand side

title: Settings: Linked user's name displays
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked their BAMNET Account
AND has set a BAMNET name filled out
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected: THEN their account's name will appear below the avatar image

title: Settings: MLB.TV logo displays if user has not set avatar
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked their BAMNET Account
AND has NOT set a BAMNET avatar
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV logo will display on the right hand side

title: Settings: Menu options when user is linked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked their BAMNET Account
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings Menu
custom_expected:
THEN the following options will display:
> Set favorite teams
> Show/hide scores
> Closed Captioning On/Off
> Unlink account

title: Settings: Menu options when user is not linked to an account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has NOT linked their BAMNET Account
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected:
THEN the following options will display:
> Show/hide scores
> Closed Captioning On/Off
> Link account

title: Favorite: Verify that if an account is not linked, 'Set favorite teams' does not display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has NOT linked to a BAMNET Account
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see an option for 'Set favorite teams'

title: Favorite: Verify that if an account is linked, 'Set favorite teams' displays as an available option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked their BAMNET Account
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected:
THEN the 'Set favorite teams' option will appear at the top of this screen
AND this will be highlighted by default

title: Scores: Verify Show Scores is set by default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has not accessed it previously
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
AND selects Show/hide scores
custom_expected:
THEN 'Show scores' will be selected by default
AND there will be an x before the setting indicating this is active

title: Scores: Setting is retained when user exits application and returns
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has modified the Show/hide scores setting
custom_steps:
WHEN the user exits the application
AND the user accesses a different Roku Channel
AND accesses the MLB.TV Channel again
custom_expected: THEN the Show/hide scores setting that the user set will be retained from what was set

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning Off is set by Default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the MLB.TV Channel
AND this is the first time the user accesses it
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
AND selects Captioning On/Off
custom_expected:
THEN 'Closed Captioning On' will be highlighted
AND 'Closed Captioning Off' will be enabled
AND this will have an x before it indicating this is set

title: CC: Verify that Setting is retained when user exits application and returns
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has modified the Captioning On/Off setting
custom_steps:
WHEN the user exits the application
AND the user accesses a different Roku Channel
AND accesses the MLB.TV Channel again
custom_expected: THEN the Captioning On/Off setting that the user set will be retained from what was set

title: Settings: Verify entitlement label appears correct for a user linked to a unentitled BAMNET Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has not previously linked an account
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the MLB.TV Channel
AND we navigate to the Settings page
AND we follow the steps to link to a BAMNET Account
AND we link to a BAMNET Account that has NO entitlements (mlbtesttv+6@gmail.com / tester)
custom_expected:
THEN the user information will appear on the Settings page
AND the access label will match he user's MLB.TV entitlement level

title: Settings: Verify after success/congratulation page properly updates when a link is performed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has not previously linked an account
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the MLB.TV Channel
AND we navigate to the Settings page
AND we select the 'Link account option'
AND we follow the steps to link to a BAMNET Account at mlb.com/roku
AND the code is accepted
custom_expected:
THEN the Roku's Code page will update
AND the user will receive a Congratulations message
AND the user can press Continue to return to the Main Menu

title: Settings: Verify user is returned to previous screen after linking account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has not previously linked an account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to access media content
AND receives a paywall
AND follows the paywall prompts to link to an account
AND successfully links to an entitled BAMNET account
custom_expected: THEN the user will be returned to the page they were trying to access the media from (ie: Game Page)

title: Settings: Verify after a user chooses Unlink Account, the user's information no longer displays
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the MLB.TV Channel
AND has successfully linked a BAMNET account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to Settings
AND selects 'Unlink Account'
AND selects 'Yes' at the verification prompt
AND Cancels out of the prompt to link a new account
AND accesses the Settings page again
custom_expected: THEN the previously linked account's user information no longer appears on the right hand side
